org.ndnx.ndn.impl.repo
Interface Policy

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicPolicy
public interface Policy

Policy is the interface used by the RepositoryStore for interpreting and applying policy data to NDN repositories.

Method Summary

Method Detail

update

void update(PolicyXML pxml,
            boolean fromNet)
            throws RepositoryException
Update the policy

Parameters:
pxml - an XML decoded policy structure
fromNet - true if request is from the network as opposed to reading a local file
Throws:
XMLStreamException - if the policy data is incorrect or inconsistent
IOException - on stream read errors
RepositoryException

updateFromInputStream

void updateFromInputStream(InputStream is)
                           throws RepositoryException
Update the policy from a file This assumes that the update is not "from the network"

Parameters:
is - stream for the file
Throws:
RepositoryException

getNamespace

ArrayList<ContentName> getNamespace()
Gets the current namespace covered by this repository. Any name not included within this namespace will not be stored in this repository.

Returns:
array of ContentNames specifying the namespace

setNamespace

void setNamespace(ArrayList<ContentName> nameSpace)

setVersion

void setVersion(String version)
Set the version of the policy protocol which is currently valid. Depending on the implementation, any policy file containing a protocol with a different version ID may be rejected.

Parameters:
version - the version to use

setLocalName

void setLocalName(String localName)
                  throws MalformedContentNameStringException
The localName is used to identify an individual repository among several in an organization or other entity.

Parameters:
localName - the name as a string in the form xxx/yyy/zzz
Throws:
MalformedContentNameStringException - if the name is formatted incorrectly

getLocalName

String getLocalName()
Returns:
- the local name of this repository as a String in the form xxx/yyy/zzz

setGlobalPrefix

void setGlobalPrefix(String globalName)
                     throws MalformedContentNameStringException
The globalPrefix is used to identify a path to repositories within an organization or entity. Several local repositories could be contained with an organizations global repository namespace.

Parameters:
globalName - the prefix as a string in the form xxx/yyy/zzz
Throws:
MalformedContentNameStringException - if the name is formatted incorrectly

getGlobalPrefix

ContentName getGlobalPrefix()
Returns:
- the local name of this repository as a String in the form xxx/yyy/zzz

getPolicyXML

PolicyXML getPolicyXML()
Returns:
- get the associated policyXML

setPolicyXML

void setPolicyXML(PolicyXML pxml)
Set the associated policyXML

Parameters:
pxml - the PolicyXML
